messageBody:
Thomas Manson wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
>
> For my test i need to keep some information between my tests:
>
> I need to connect to a workflow server and make operation on it...
>
> For example to get on Task i need to :
>
> connect (connection identifier),
> Start a procedure as a (get the id of the new task)
> make several test operation on this task ( with the ID)
>
>
> How could i do that?
> It seems that between two test a new TestCase() is done so a classe
> variable cannot be used.

In order to share data between tests, you need to use global data (that
is, public static data). This is required because you (mostly) give up
control over instantiating your test objects.

That said, you can always write your tests so that they don't need each
other. I guess you have this:

* A few tests for connecting
* Several tests that use a connected object

The second category of tests do not necessarily need to use the same
connection from the first category of tests. The second category of
tests can simply reconnect!

In one test suite:

MyConnectingTests ... {
testOk
testFailedBecauseOfX
testFailedBecauseOfY
}

MyOperatingTests ... {
private Connection connection;

setUp() {
connectToWorkflowObject();
}

testDoXWithWorkflow ...
testDoYWithWorkflow ....
}

Each of the "operating tests" connects (separately) to the same workflow
object. Just make sure that tearDown() closes the connection after each
test.
